title: Rolling - 2 wheels - same speed different total KE

content.question: Wheels <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> have the same radius and roll without slipping on a horizontal surface. The translational speed and rotational kinetic energy of both wheels is the same. However, the total kinetic energy of Wheel <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is greater than the total kinetic energy of Wheel <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>. Which of the following correctly describes Wheel <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> in comparison to Wheel <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>?

choices.label: Wheel <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is more massive and on average, its mass is distributed closer to the wheel’s center.
Wheel <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is more massive and on average, its mass is distributed farther from the wheel’s center.
Wheel <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is less massive and on average, its mass is distributed closer to the wheel’s center.
Wheel <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is less massive and on average, its mass is distributed farther from the wheel’s center.

content.answer: Wheel <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is more massive and on average, its mass is distributed closer to the wheel’s center.
